required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of the Dermal Filler for Female Intimate Area Hydration and Atrophy of the Vagina.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Uncontrolled Single Centre Study for the Evaluation of the Performance Characteristics (Efficacy and Safety) of the Dermal Filler MMG-23-04-2019 (Hyaluronic Acid 2,0%) for Female Intimate Area Hydration and Atrophy of the Vagina.

brief_summary.textblock: The study is an open-label uncontrolled single-center study for the evaluation of the Performance characteristics (efficacy and safety) of the dermal filler "MMG-23-04-2019" on the female genital area for the medicinal, functional and reconstructive indications.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Dermal Filler is recommended for the female intimate areas, especially the internal area of the vagina (vaginal vestibule, introitus, vaginal walls, clitoris, "G" spot) for the following indications: vaginal dryness or discomfort, vaginal atrophy.
The main functional ingredient is cross-linked hyaluronic acid of non-animal origin, produced through bacterial fermentation.
The MMG-23-04-2019 is contained in pre-filled, graduated and disposable sterile syringe with Luer Lock adapter with 1 ml of net content and 20 mg/ml hyaluronic acid.
The MMG-23-04-2019 has been classified as a Class III medical device under Annex IX of Directive MDD 93/42 EEC since it is a long-term, invasive and absorbable medical device.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in the properties of the vaginal wall, measured by the VMI.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through study completion, an average of 60 days - daily.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency and severity of adverse events (AEs) and adverse device effect

secondary_outcome.measure: The change in the Gloria Bachmann Vaginal Health Index (VHI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Day 30 (4 weeks) and Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: The VHI is a score formed by 5 parameters (vaginal elasticity, vaginal secretions, pH, epithelial mucous membrane, vaginal hydration). The final score defines the degree of atrophy in the genitourinary tract by assigning a single score to each parameter. The maximum possible score is 25, while the minimum possible score is 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: The absolute change in Visual Analogous Scale (VAS).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Day 30 (4 weeks) and Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute change in VAS, ranged between 0 (no pain) and 10 (worst possible pain), judged by the Principal Investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: The absolute change in Visual Analogous Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 30 (4 weeks) and Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: The absolute change in VAS ranged between 0 (no pain) and 10 (worst possible pain), judged by the subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of the Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI) score.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 30 and Day 60 (up to 4 weeks and 8 weeks respectively).
secondary_outcome.description: The FSFI is a validated questionnaire to measure the sexual functioning of women. The score ranges between 2 (minimum) and 36 (maximum).

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject satisfaction evaluated by the Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 30 (4 weeks) to Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: The PGI-I is a transition single question scale, asking the patient to rate their urinary tract condition now, as compared with how it was prior to before beginning treatment on a scale from 1 (Very much better) to 7 (Very much worse)

secondary_outcome.measure: The change if the Nugent Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: The Nugent Score is a Gram stain scoring system for vaginal swabs to diagnose bacterial vaginosis, relying on scoring of individual types of organisms; a score of 0 to 10 is derived from a weighted combination of the following: large Gram-positive rods (lactobacilli; decrease in Lactobacillus scored as 0 to 4), small Gram-negative or Gram-variable rods (G. vaginalis or other anaerobes; scored as 0 to 4), and curved Gram-negative or Gram-variable rods (Mobiluncus spp.; scored as 0 to 2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 up to Day 60 (up to 8 weeks).
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the mitotic activity of the mucosa (Ki-67 proliferation marker - %).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 0 to Day 30 and Day 60 (up to week 4 and 8 respectively).
secondary_outcome.description: To register the overall discomfort and satisfaction of the subjects.

arm_group.description: MMG-23-04-2019 is composed by sodium hyaluronate at concentration of 2% (20 mg/ml) with 1,4-Butanediol diglycidyl ether (BDDE) acting as a cross-linking agent, in aqueous solution at physiological pH. The filler of 1ml is administered once or twice depending on the individual necessity.

intervention.description: The dermal filler MMG-23-04-2019 is applied to the female intimate area (intramucosal administration) of vaginal vestibule, vaginal walls, clitoris, "G" spot.
